title: Sets
question: This will create a set with two items – true or false?
hint: Sets are similar to arrays, except they can't contain duplicate items and are unordered.

correct.reason: Sets must contain unique items, so the second "Red" will be discarded.
This creates a set containing 9 and 10.
Sets must contain unique items, so the second and subsequent instances of 1 and 2 will be discarded.
Sets must contain unique items, so the second and subsequent instances of 100 will be discarded.

correct.answer: var readings = Set([true, false, true, true])
correct.reason: Sets must contain unique items, so the second and subsequent instances of true will be discarded.
This creates a set of Sean and Paul.

wrong.reason: This creates an array, not a set.
This creates an array, not a set.
To create a set you must pass in an array of items rather than just loose integers.
Sets do not contain duplicate items, so this set will contain the numbers 1, 2, and 3 – it has three items rather than two.
This set will contain three items rather than two.
This set will contain one item rather than two.
